title: Climate Change Impact Assessment and Modeling
description: Advanced research on climate change impacts using satellite data, machine learning, and hydrological modeling. Focus on extreme weather events, precipitation patterns, and flood risk assessment.
publications: Understanding spatiotemporal variation of heatwave projections across US cities
Projected Changes in Precipitation Extremes Across the Mississippi River Basin
funding: HICORPS Project - ERDC and WOOLPERT Collaboration

title: Heatwave Analysis and Urban Climate Studies
description: Comprehensive analysis of heatwave patterns, urban heat islands, and their impacts on vulnerable communities using satellite-based observations and machine learning techniques.
publications: Spatiotemporal Characterization of Heatwave Exposure across Historically Vulnerable Communities
Spatiotemporal characterization of heatwaves on an urban center using satellite-based estimates

title: Compound Hazard Assessment
description: Research on compound climate hazards including the interaction between precipitation, storm surge, and coastal flooding. Development of multi-hazard risk assessment frameworks.
publications: Evaluating the Compound Effects of Precipitation and Storm Surge on Coastal Flooding Risk
funding: ORISE Fellowship - U.S. Department of Defense

title: Satellite-Based Precipitation Analysis
description: Comparative analysis of satellite precipitation products across different geographic regions, validation studies, and development of optimal satellite performance metrics.
publications: Comparative Analysis of Satellite-Based Precipitation Data across the CONUS and Hawaii
